1.content:
“I think that this qualifies as a successful test, gentlemen,” Doctor Sheldon Cooper said. “You may have five minutes in which to congratulate me.”

None of his three companions responded, being far more taken aback by the surroundings than their friend’s predictable pride. It wasn’t that they were in a place unfamiliar to them; quite the opposite. But for all the time that they’d spent gaming and geeking in that apartment, the view from an inch above the floor was a new experience. Everything was so much more huge and intimidating, and nothing more so than the device responsible for their current predicament, balanced upon the coffee table an untold height above.

“That’s… a little out of our reach…” Doctor Leonard Hoffstadter said, de-craning his neck to look around at his friends.

“Yup,” Howard Wolowitz concurred, “We’ve as much chance of getting up there as Raj has of winning American Idol.”

“Hey!” Doctor Rajesh Koothrappali protested. “That’s not due to lack of talent, but because they have a very narrow definition of what counts as ‘American’.”

“What, Americans?”

“I can’t believe that you two are bickering before you’ve even congratulated me on my achievement!" Sheldon shouted. "I’ve accomplished what no scientist ever has, and successfully miniaturised matter!”

“Well, that’s fine and all, but if we can’t get up there to restore ourselves, you’re going to have trouble lifting your Nobel Prize, Wayne Szalinski,” Leonard said.

“While I am offended by the comparison to an accident-prone fictional character, I will cede that you make a valid point. Still, it should be a simple matter for our combined intellects to solve such a rudimentary problem.”

Such a frenzied bout of cogitating was interrupted by seismic rumblings reverberating through the floor of the apartment, coinciding with loud crashings from the other side of the half-open door.

“I can hardly think with that racket going on,” Sheldon snapped. “Why didn’t you close the door behind you when you entered?”

“You’re the one that demanded we get over here at once. You were quite insistent.”

“Be that as it may –“

The rest of the words were drowned out by the loudest crash yet, as a foot belonging to a perfectly normal-sized human crossed the threshold of the apartment. Each of the four looked to the doorway, dreading what they might see.

The four nerds immediately recognized Penny as the person who had just stepped into their appartment. However, before any of them could react, the "gigantic" blondie walked towards them. Fortunately, her flip-flop landed right next to the shrunken group, which caused them all to fall on their bottoms. They stared up in awe at the girl looming above, mouth wide open. "Leonard? Sheldon? Anybody here?", she called, looking around, hands on her hips.

"W...wow...", managed to say Leonard, standing up, while still following Penny's bare leg all the way up to her face. "Even her ankle alone is twice our height! She must be 400' tall to us!"

"No kidding!", said Howard, as the other three stood up too. "It's very...different to see Penny from this perspective.", he said, enjoying the view.

"Different?", asked Sheldon, raising an eyebrow. "I'd like to believe that you two would already be used to stare up at Penny, since she's normaly a couple of inches taller than you. And by the way, considering our current height, compared to us, she's 395' tall".

Even as he knew she wasn't hearing, he still couldn't speak. Meanwhile, Penny scratched her head, confused, seeing that the door was open, yet no one seemed to be around.

"Hey!", said Leonard. "Why don't we ask Penny for help? She can reach the device and reverse it."

"Excuse me?!", said Sheldon. "I don't trust Penny with such an important task. Sure, a simple one, but I'd rather trust a lab monkey than her. She might ruin it with a single mistake, and end up much smaller than we already are. Or even worse, we'd have a gargantuan Penny stamping around the city!"

111.content:
"Besides," Howard smiled, "that machine would never cause Penny to grow and you know it! There's no way that it has a stable enough power source to accommodate that much... expansion..."

"Well I never predicted that it would shrink all four of us either, so like Batman we should endeavour to be prepared for all eventualities, no matter how unlikely," Sheldon replied. "But... This is nothing new. Penny has always had a physical advantage over each of us, and just because it has now been magnified several times over does not diminish the fact that even you remain an intellectual giant in comparison to her. It should be simplicity itself to utilise her size to our advantage."

Even as these words left his mouth, Penny had shifted her weight slightly. While a minor movement to her, the boys had to dash to one side to avoid being flattened beneath her flip-flop. Again,the shock wave of her foot hitting the apartment floor put them all to the ground.

"By all means," Leonard said, "begin utilising it!"

"We first need her attention. One of you three must run across the floor in such a manner as to catch her gaze, and then a line of communication can be established."

"Why one of us three? Why not you?"

"Oh, you know I'm no good at running! And secondly, it's incredibly likely that Penny may just mistake the volunteer as a bug and attempt to squish him!"

Off their looks, he added: "And for such a sacrifice on behalf of his fellows, that man would be considered a hero, and definitely gain a dedication in the paper I publish on this subject. Anyhoo, I think that this task would be best performed by..."

"HER?!" Sheldon snapped. "I'd rather trust Penny or Leslie Winkle with such a task. All Missy would do is-"

He was interrupted as the colossus began to move once again. Not seeing anyone, Missy decided to plop down on Sheldon's spot.

It was at this point that Sheldon did his trademark impersonation of a steam kettle, his face turning red as a vein began trying to burst free from his forehead.

"We're not using her". He ground out.

"Well what choice do we have?" Leonard asked.

"We're not just gonna stay like this forever due to some sibling rivalry." Howard added.

Before Sheldon could retort, the shadows danced around as Missy moved again, everyone looking up at her.

1) Missy sees the guys, offering to return their size in exchange for a foot rub after a long plane ride.

134.content:
“Oh dear?” Leonard reiterated. “This girl worshipped the ground you walked on, and then you threw her out of the apartment!”

“You’re right, Leonard. She’ll see this as a chance to get back on my good side, and jump at the chance to help me!”

“So long as she doesn’t do any jumping any time soon,” Howard muttered, casting his eyes up and down (but mainly up) the monumental sneakers standing in the doorway.

“Yeah, at the moment she’s so fat she’s makes Howard’s momma look like a petite dumpling,” Raj added.

Howard rounded on him. “Yo momma jokes? Really? At a time like this?”

“I thought that a little levity might lighten the mood, dude.”

“It might’ve done, if that had been at all funny. Leave the jokes to the professionals, okay?”

“Fine, but if you ask me, I was giving yo momma a compliment.”

“She is standing rather still,” Leonard said.

“Of course; if Howard’s mom moves too fast, she might fall, and no one wants to see that.”

“Not Howard’s mom, Ramona! Why’s she just standing there?”

“Probably wondering where I am, so she can apologise to me,” Sheldon beamed. “I think it’s only polite for me to put her out of her misery.”

With a swagger to his step, Sheldon stepped toward Ramona’s right foot, seemingly unconcerned that with his arms fully extended above his head he would only just have been able to reach over the toe of her shoe. His friends lacked that self-confidence.

“Should we, maybe, try to restrain him?” Leonard said. “None of us want to see Sheldon squashed like a bug, right?”

“Rather him than me,” Howard offered. At Leonard’s look, he quickly spoke again. “Fine, fine; if it’ll put you at ease, I’ll chase after the little lug and make sure he doesn’t hurt himself.” He gulped. “Although I do warn you, at the first sign of trouble I am running straight away.”

“Yes, you know well to fear the large women, don’t you?”

“Still not funny, Raj.”

“Fine. But while he’s off with Sheldon, what should we do?”

“I don’t know. Maybe we should hide by the couch until we get an idea of how this thing’s gonna turn out…”

Leonard and Raj scurried across the floor hastily, while high above Ramona began to speak, her voice thundering down at the apartment floor.

“Doctor Cooper? I know that we didn’t part on good terms, and you probably don’t want to see me again, but my conscience wouldn’t keep me away. You see, when you threw me out, I took something of yours as a little keepsake, to remember the good times we had together. But it’s not right, and I’ll just… I’ll just leave it on the floor here, and you can come pick it up when I’m gone.”

She began to stoop, her form descending rapidly upon tiny Sheldon below.
134.title: Ramona

1341.content:
“Oh my God,” Ramona breathed as she spotted the inch-tall form of her one-time object of worship at her feet. “Doctor Cooper? Is that you?”

Sheldon treated her to his most condescending smirk as he shook his head, knowing full well that she wouldn’t be able to hear his words. The movement prompted Ramona to drop to her knees, hands braced either side of the tiny scientist as she brought her face in for a closer look at him.

As Howard jogged closer, he couldn’t take his eyes off the colossal head hanging above, ginger tresses tied neatly behind. Ramona’s youthful features were all open in surprise: eyes wide, mouth gaping, flared nostrils blasting the ground with hot air. Surprisingly, Sheldon was standing firm in the face of it all. Say what else you liked about the guy, sometimes he refused to see what danger he was in.

“I can’t believe this,” Ramona said. “This is… is incredible. Did you do this, Doctor Cooper?”

“Of course,” Sheldon replied loudly. “Who else could be brilliant enough to have developed a method of miniaturising matter?”

“Couldn’t have built it without help!” Howard shouted, jumping next to him. “See, he draws up the plans, and the top engineer in the business puts it together for him.”

Howard looked directly up at Ramona’s left eye, noticing his own reflection therein. “He may have the brains, but I’m the one that likes to get my hands dirty.”

“Ew,” she said, her lip curling. Her hand came forward, and Howard had only a moment to register that before a finger flicked out, a delicate nail the size of his torso striking him directly. The engineer went tumbling away across the floor.

Sheldon, taken aback by this, was ignorant of the hand’s further movements until it had surrounded him, fingers curling around him to block out all light. Coccooned within human skin, he screamed.

Ramona rose and left the apartment, one tiny human in her possession and three left behind.

13411.content:
Ramona could barely contain her excitement on the journey home. While walking, while at the bus stop, while on the bus itself, she had the urge to open her palm and gaze upon the tiny Doctor Sheldon Cooper that she had. But each time there were others present, lesser minds who couldn’t appreciate her trophy. Painful though it was, she would have to wait until she was in the privacy of her own bedroom before unclenching her fist.

For his part, Sheldon was in Hell. A loathing of human contact was not something to suffer when enclosed on all sides by skin, flesh, bone, blood… Sweat. The longer he remained in that ungodly prison, the more his captor’s hands began to sweat, and now he was liberally soaked in her juices. When he got out of this situation, she would be the subject of some stern words indeed.

It may have seemed like hours when the fingers unfolded to allow light entry, but with his eidetic memory Sheldon was well aware that only thirty-seven and a half minutes had passed.

Ramona’s face hung disconcertingly close overhead, but it couldn’t be any worse than what he’d experienced for the last half hour. Wiping the back of a sleeve across his forehead, his other hand wagged a finger. “That’s two strikes, young lady.”

Even with it written large on the sky above him, Sheldon couldn’t quite place the emotion on Ramona’s face. Maybe she was grief-stricken, as well she should be for having forced him to endure such cramped quarters? He was just about to voice this conclusion when she spoke herself, her voice and damp breath drowning all counter-argument.

“You haven’t changed, have you? After all the help I gave you in developing the Cooper-Nowitzki Theorem, you kicked me out, and now this! Well… fine!”

The hand tilted, throwing Sheldon to a soft surface, expansive and white. A bed. Standing, he could look around and see where he was, a few Tyrannosaur-sized teddy-bears holding court at the far end.

Ramona stood to one side, looking down at the floor rather than at him. Shame? Her continued speech cleared matters up.

“You owe me. And if you’re not going to share the credit with me, then I guess you’re going to have to pay me back for every little thing I did!”

If Sheldon had thought being held in her hand was disgusting, he would have to re-asses his criteria for using that word. With one motion she brought her bare foot bouncing down before him, and the stench it gave off was enough to force him to his knees. “Dear lord…”

“Let’s start with the pedicure, shall we?” Ramona said, wiggling her toes at the diminutive physicist.

152.content:
“Is that-“

“Yes,” Howard cut Leonard’s question off with a smug grin. “That’s Michaela, from Vegas.”

“The prostitute from Vegas?” Raj asked, incredulous.

“How many other Michaela’s did I meet out there in the depths of my despair, Raj?”

“She’s wearing the same dress as that night.”

“Yeah, that was my request. I mean, I kept her contact details for when I got lonely again, and she’s always willing to do house calls for a little extra…”

“A little extra? I know how much we paid for her for that one night in Vegas, but to get her all the way out here… No wait I’ve got something way more important to ask you: why did you get her to come to my apartment?”

“Geez Leonard, I’m not going to get her to come to my house! What would my mom say? When one of you answers the door to her, you’re not going to scare her off.”

“Howard?” the woman cooed gently above, using her faked Jewish accent. “Are you hiding from me? Do you want me to find you?”

“Oh God yes,” Howard said.

“Because that’ll cost extra. And I’d need to know in advance. So, I’ll just sit here, running up your tab, until you come out and tell me what exactly you want.”

The guys resumed running as the high-quality stilettos of the woman crashed down amongst them, the prostitute sitting down heavily on the couch.

“Well,” Sheldon said, “since it appears that Howard has hired the services of this complete stranger in my apartment, it seems to me that he should be able to get her to restore us to our regular size, for a small fee.”

He paused.

“Why did no one laugh? I used the word ‘small’, when we ourselves are-“

“We get it, Sheldon, we’re just not in the laughing mood right now. In fact, we’re more concerned with working out a method by which Howard can contact his hired hand.”

info.brief_description: Geniuses they may be, but the cast of TV's Big Bang Theory are in trouble when they shrink
info.description:
The premise for this is fairly simple; those geniuses from The Big Bang Theory get shrunk, and trouble ensues. Unlike many other shrinking stories that appear on this site, I'd like to keep this one 'clean', if at all possible. Nothing more risque than the show it's based on, and try to keep the characters in-character.

Continuity-wise... 'cuz of course, a story about the Big Bang Theory has to worry about continuity, assume only enough has happened on a chapter branch to allow the appearance of characters thus far mentioned. There is no set time-period that the story is set in, and many of the branches will diverge from each other into various points across different seasons. Don't get allSheldon about it, and you'll be fine.
